attributes.action: Petition against the Mayor's introduction of Emmissions Influence Charging (EIC)
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Mayor Ken Livinstone has announced that he would wish to introduce Emissions Influenced Charging to the London Congestion Charging Scheme.
The proposed Congestion Charging bands are as follows:

Cars which emit up to 120g/km CO2 and are Euro IV (Equivalent to VED Bands A & B) - 100% discount.

Cars which emit 121-225g/km CO2 (Equivalent to VED Bands C – F) - Standard Charge £8.00.

Cars which emit more than 225g/km CO2 (Equivalent to the VED Band G) - £25.00

This is a retrospective tax on people who have bought their vehicles before the tax consideration (this cannot be allowed in a country with the rule of law).
It is believed that most of this money will probably go towards the funding of the deficit in the olympics budget!

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
